'VDM Publishing' is a German publishing group based in SaarbrÃ¼cken, Germany,
with offices in Argentina, {{Cite web
| title = Editorial alemana se radicarÃ¡ en la ciudad generando 100 puestos de
| trabajo language = Spanish work = VillaMaria.gov.ar publisher = Municipalidad
| Villa MarÃ­a location = Villa MarÃ­a accessdate = 2011-07-02 year = 2010 url =
| http://www.villamaria.gov.ar/prensa/nota.php?id=827
| archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5zs0cwfoj |archivedate=2011-07-02
}} Latvia, Mauritius and Moldova. . Its book
production is based on print on demand technology.

VDM publishing's imprintsâAlphascript, Betascript, Fastbook Publishing and
Doyen Verlagâspecialize in publishing and selling Wikipedia articles in
printed form via print on demand, in e-commerce bookstores. {{Cite web | title = Alphascript
Publishing's partners
| work = Alphascript-publishing.com | publisher = VDM Publishing House |
| location = Beau-Bassin, Mauritius | accessdate = 2010-08-03 | url = http://www.alphascript-
| publishing.com/index.php?&act=nav&nav=10054 | archiveurl =
| http://www.webcitation.org/5sDEbDu3N | archivedate = 2010-08-23}}
| Alphascript distributes publications through several on-line book retailers.
| At least some of the books are actually printed by Amazon.com. As of November
| 2010, around 150,000 such titles have been produced. In June 2010, VDM started
| its own online-bookshop: MoreBooks! Publishing.

VDM's publishing methods have received criticism for the soliciting of
manuscripts from thousands of individuals, for providing non-notable authors
with the appearance of a peer-reviewed publishing history, for benefiting from
the free contributions of online volunteers, and for insufficiently disclosing
the free nature of their content. VDM responds that Wikipedia is a valuable,
quality resource, that the company has no problem asking authors for content,
that buyers are informed of where information comes from, that books are a
convenient form to collect articles about interesting subjects, and that its
customers are satisfied with VDM's products. {{Cite web | last = Ghanty |
first = Reezwan| title = Letter reproduced in: Massage-Research.com - A Letter
from AlphaScript
| work = Massage-Research.com| accessdate = 2011-08-19| date = 2011-04-30| url =
| http://www.massage-research.com/blog/?p=1215 |archiveurl =
| http://www.webcitation.org/613SdJN6V | archivedate = 2011-08-19}}
